ca.ualberta.cmput301w15t13.Fragments

Class ClaimViewerFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • ca.ualberta.cmput301w15t13.Fragments.ClaimViewerFragment

  • public class ClaimViewerFragment
extends Fragment
    This fragment is used to view claims and surface level details, including name, cost, status and dates. These fields are prone to change or grow. Outstanding Issues: Getting claimant and approver specific claims should be moved to a controller

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void approveClaim(int claimIndex)
      An approver will approve the selected claim back to the user, with the updated information (comments).
      void approverApproveComment(int claimIndex) 
      void approverComment(int claimIndex)
      Upon returning a claim, an approver must write comments for reason why This method will call comment fragment for approver to comment returnClaim method will be called once an approver has finished commenting
      void deleteClaim(int claimIndex)
      Delete the selected claim and update the view.
      void editClaim(int claimIndex)
      When permissible for the user and the clicked claim, change the fragment to the ClaimManager and fill the fields with the existing data.
      void filterByTag(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> tagIndexes)
      Given the user selected tag indices, make an array of tags, Pass it to the filter function, which gets returns the filtered claim IDs, then get them from the claimList and finally display the filtered Claims

      An approver will return the selected claim back to the user, with the updated information (comments).
      void submitClaim(int claimIndex)
      Changes the selected claim's status to submitted, which allows it to be viewed by approvers.

      • editClaim

        public void editClaim(int claimIndex)
        When permissible for the user and the clicked claim, change the fragment to the ClaimManager and fill the fields with the existing data.

      • deleteClaim

        public void deleteClaim(int claimIndex)
        Delete the selected claim and update the view.

      • viewClaim

        public void viewClaim(int claimIndex)
        View the selected claim's claim-level details.

      • submitClaim

        public void submitClaim(int claimIndex)
        Changes the selected claim's status to submitted, which allows it to be viewed by approvers.

      • returnClaim

        public void returnClaim(int claimIndex)
        An approver will return the selected claim back to the user, with the updated information (comments).

      • openFilterDialog

        public void openFilterDialog()
        If the user has already filtered they need to reset before filtering again. This checks if the claims are filtered and resets the claim-view is so. Else it Opens a dialog letting the user select which Tags they want to filter by. Because the multi-choice dialog works only with String arrays we must use them.

      • filterByTag

        public void filterByTag(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> tagIndexes)
        Given the user selected tag indices, make an array of tags, Pass it to the filter function, which gets returns the filtered claim IDs, then get them from the claimList and finally display the filtered Claims
        Parameters:
        tagIndexes -
